name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Darwin

reviews.title: Great Service, Excellent Location & Refurbished Rooms
reviews.text: First off it is important to point out this is an old hotel but its location on the Esplanade is superb and with an ocean view room you wake up with a wonderful view over Darwin Harbour and the Arafura Sea. The rooms are well appointed and recently refurbished, however, the bathroom renovation was done cheaply so it is the poorest element of the hotel. The lighting in the bathrooms is terrible it really does need to be addressed. One minor quibble is that it is disappointing not to have an iPhone/iPod dock as most modern hotels seem to have. Any minor issues with fit out are well and truly outweighed by the excellent service I have experienced in two stays since it switched to Hilton management. Staff have been friendly and courteous and genuinely will go the extra yard for you, something uncommon in most Darwin Hotels. This helpfulness extends very much to the restaurant staff,i particularly the breakfast team who are always welcoming and helpful no matter how busy they are. This is a well managed property that I would recommend for business and for a couples get away but make sure you get an ocean view room where you will be able to take in the spectacular sunset over the Arafura Sea.
Recently rebranded from the holiday inn.
reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely location and lots special touches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice and bright hotel, right by the water.
reviews.title: Great views, average quality accomodations

reviews.text: Tropical gardens with a nice pool and restaurant.
reviews.title: Basic Hotel in a good position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice touches such as a cookie on arrival and willing to help with anything you need. Also knowledgable on things to do in the Darwin area.
reviews.title: A mixed experience

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights last week. The hotel is one of those old 1970s Travelodge tri-arc designs, which I personally quite love but which are, it must be said, somewhat dated. To be honest, I think the best thing to do with a building like this is to go with the retro theme rather than trying to tart it up with a contemporary look.
reviews.title: It's okay, but that's all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was comfortable by the bathroom is very tired and if thy replaced the horrid bath over shower with a nice freestanding shower it would really lift the whole room.
reviews.title: Not up to standard

reviews.text: Staff were efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Doubletree Hilton

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was unexciting.
reviews.title: Imagine 34 deg C and no water for shower.....unexpected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good.
reviews.title: Ok room but struggled with the admin staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was worried about the negative postings but we are very happy with our room and the hotel is no way as bad as the negatives say. The staff have been excellent, pleasant and very helpful so if you are worried don't be. Doubletree staff are working hard to please. The Restaurant ambience is very pleasant. - The Barramundi we enjoyed very much. we watched the chefs work unaware we were watching them and the attention to detail was 'master chef' standard. Well done Doubletree.
reviews.title: All good at doubletree

reviews.text: The Hotel is very antiquated and is in serious need of refurbishment. It appears that there has been no serious update since the 70s and entirely unreasonable to associate the Hilton Brand with these standards. Also, the inability to access free wi-fi for any extended period beyond 30 min per day is not good enough in this day and age especially if one is paying $300 per night. The lack of accommodation in Darwin allows the Hotel to be viable at the current standards/prices - however this would not be the case in any other capital cities. I do appreciate the good efforts of the staff who provide an excellent service at the Hotel.
reviews.title: Double Tree by Hilton (Darwin)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the rooms to be spacious, clean and very quiet. The bed was very comfortable and the Motel was within easy walking distance to the CBD and local attractions. The pool area was excellently maintained with plenty of recliners and easy access to the restaurant and bar. As this was our first time to Darwin, the Motel and staff gave a great first impression of the city and we can't wait to return for another holiday.
reviews.title: First Darwin Holiday

reviews.text: This place has just been taken over by the Hilton chain from Holiday Inn. Nothing has changed except the food. The standard has dropped, especially the In-Room menu. After 10 pm the only options are a pizza or a curry, surely they can lift their act a bit and get it back to the standard of the past.
reviews.title: Below Average

reviews.text: During our 5 night stay the staff of this hotel were exceptional in their attention to our needs. Personal service and very prompt attention to our only issue-dripping toilet-rectified promptly. In house dining was also friendly and staff made our stay memorable.The best group of warm friendly staff we have encountered in a large hotel here or overseas! Very impressed.
reviews.title: Great staff added to very good hotel
Double Tree Hotel - "Its not our fault"
reviews.text: Stayed at Double Tree one week after the Hilton took over. The single room had a view over the dumpster and bins. I attempted to call reception with the details on the card next to the phone and also the concierge. No answer from either. Bar shut at 10.30pm on the Sunday and Monday night. Iron did not work in the room and as I was unable to contact reception I had to take it down although I was in a hurry for an awards presentation elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On checkout I was again presented with a bill for accomodation although it had been paid weeks earlier. If I did not have a copy of emails acknowleding payment I would have had to pay again. When I asked about the phone not being answered at reception I was told that the Hilton Management had come through the previous week and put out cards in each room with the incorrect phone numbers on them, I suggesated that perhaps they should have been removed. Reply, Its not our fault... Bar Closing at 10.30pm? Reply, should shut at midnight but we have just changed to the Hilton so it is not our fault. .. Why did they try and charge me twice for the room?... The records did not transfer when the Hilton took over so it is not our fault. This check out procedure took 35 mins after I commenced it at 9.30am. I missed breakfast and when I asked what I could do I was told to go down to one of the cafes in the shopping precinct and buy some. I filled out a comments card but have heard nothing. I presume it was filed in the rubbish bin.
reviews.title: We were very happy with this hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed at Double Tree by choice and were very pleased we did. It may not be the most modern hotel but the top service and friendly staff made our stay very enjoyable. The pool is very relaxing and not too over crowded.
reviews.title: Average, Definitely not Hilton Standards But Good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shocked that these guys can call themselves a Hilton! They are the old holiday inn and are more suited to that standard.
reviews.title: Very Good for one night - good location - but it costs too much

reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights and it did the job as I was hardly there. The rooms are large, my bathroom has a horrible smell to it but could not be bothered to complain as I was hardly going to be there.
reviews.title: Poor Rooms High Price

description: DoubleTree by Hilton Darwin is accessible to Darwin CBD, vibrant Mitchell Street, Crocosaurus Cove and Darwin Wharf. The hotel features 24 hour reception and room service and hosts a breakfast in the poolside restaurant for those early risers who embark on day tours or business to the region. Restaurant overlooks the pool and surrounding gardens.
